channel.title: Server NIO question
channel.description: What is the amount of bytes that is sent the SECOND you click Login on the 317 client? I wrote the NIO connection method from scratch, and it was originally reading 2 bytes the second i clicked login. Now, it wouldn't actually login, but it connected, and read 2 bytes. Now i changed the way it's called, and now it's reading 0 bytes. What should it be reading?

item.title: Server NIO question
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

okay, because when i use NIO, it only sends 2 bytes when i try to send a null to the server using a crasher. when i try to login using a normal client, it doesn’t read any bytes.

Read full topic

item.title: Server NIO question
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

The client adds two bytes to the buffer and flushes it.

aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_1192.writeByte(14);
aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_1192.writeByte(i);
aClass24_1168.method271(2, 0, aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_1192.buffer, 0);

Read full topic

What is the amount of bytes that is sent the SECOND you click Login on the 317 client? I wrote the NIO connection method from scratch, and it was originally reading 2 bytes the second i clicked login. Now, it wouldn’t actually login, but it connected, and read 2 bytes. Now i changed the way it’s called, and now it’s reading 0 bytes. What should it be reading?
